page.title: 19SUMBURGH AIRPORT
page.content: The first landing strip was built at Sumburgh in 1933 because of the flat land. In 1934 the first flight from Aberdeen was made with three commercial travellers as passengers. But they never made schedule flights until one year later. The airport was expanded and a new terminal built for the North Sea Oil Rig workers in 1978. However, when the long range helicopters were introduced this terminal became underused and it was opened to the general public. In 1984 75263 people went through the airport and 320 planes on average landed per week. Also 105 private planes came and went. An air_sea rescue service is run by Bristow Helicopters in conjunction with the Coastguards. In drastic emergencies British Airways also help.
